data.Title: Google Search Console Performance Report Delays
data.Description: Google has confirmed delays in the Google Search Console Performance reports and is working on a fix. This issue occurs periodically, and Google typically resolves it over time.

data.Title: Google Merchant Center Updates Conversion Data Usage
data.Description: Google Merchant Center is changing how it uses conversion data shared by merchants. Google may use this data for new reporting features and to improve Google Search experiences and services.

data.Title: YouTube Updates Policy on AI-Generated Content
data.Description: YouTube will now allow users to request the removal of AI-generated content that simulates their face or voice. This policy change aims to address concerns about privacy and misinformation.

data.Title: Bing Adds Prompt Injection to Webmaster Guidelines
data.Description: Bing has updated its Webmaster Guidelines to address prompt injection, a security vulnerability that can manipulate AI-powered systems. Website owners are prohibited from using techniques that exploit this vulnerability.

data.Title: Google Explains the Negative Impact of Soft 404 Errors
data.Description: Google's Gary Illyes explains that soft 404 errors, where a page returns a 200 OK status but should return a 404 Not Found, negatively impact crawl budget and search rankings.

data.Title: Google June 2024 Spam Update Completed
data.Description: Google has completed the rollout of its June 2024 spam update, which aimed to improve the quality of search results by demoting websites engaging in spammy practices.

data.Title: Debate Arises Over "Fair Use" of Open Web Content
data.Description: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman sparked controversy by stating that content on the open web is "freeware" due to fair use principles. Critics argue that fair use does not grant permission for commercial reuse without consent.
